statements.name: PROC CIMPORT
statements.help:
PROC CIMPORT 
    destination=libref      | <libref.>
     member-name
    <options>;
	EXCLUDE   SAS file(s) | catalog entry(s)
     </         MEMTYPE=mtype>
     </         ENTRYTYPE=entry-type>;
    
	SELECT 
     SAS file(s) | catalog       entry(s)
     </         MEMTYPE=mtype>
     </         ENTRYTYPE=entry-type>;

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a SAS catalog.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a is a SAS data set.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: specifies that the file type is a is a SAS library.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the specific catalog, SAS data set, or SAS library as the destination of the transport file. If the destination argument is CATALOG or DATA, you can specify both a libref and a member name. If the libref is omitted, PROC CIMPORT uses the default library as the libref, which is usually the WORK library. If the destination argument is LIBRARY, specify only a libref.

arguments.name: libref.member-name
arguments.description: specifies the specific catalog, SAS data set, or SAS library as the destination of the transport file. If the destination argument is CATALOG or DATA, you can specify both a libref and a member name. If the libref is omitted, PROC CIMPORT uses the default library as the libref, which is usually the WORK library. If the destination argument is LIBRARY, specify only a libref.

arguments.name: COMPRESS=
arguments.description: Specifies how the resulting CIMPORT data set is to be compressed.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that the data set produced by CIMPORT is not compressed.

arguments.name: CHAR
arguments.description: specifies that the observations in a newly created SAS data set are compressed (producing variable-length records) by using RLE (Run Length Encoding). RLE compresses observations by reducing repeated runs of the same character (including blanks) to two-byte or three-byte representations.

arguments.name: BINARY
arguments.description: specifies that the observations in a newly created SAS data set are compressed (producing variable-length records) by using RDC (Ross Data Compression). RDC combines run-length encoding and sliding-window compression to compress the file by representing repeated byte patterns more efficiently.

arguments.name: EET=
arguments.description: excludes specified entry types from the import process.

arguments.name: ENCODINGINFO=
arguments.description: specifies the number of data set headers to read in order to output the encoding value of the data set to the log.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that all data set headers are read. The encoding value stored for the data set header is output to the SAS log.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies an integer greater than zero. This value represents the number of data set headers to read. The encoding value stored for the data set header is output to the SAS log.

arguments.name: ET=
arguments.description: specifies entry types to import.

arguments.name: EXTENDSN=
arguments.description: specifies whether to extend by 1 byte the length of short numerics (less than 8 bytes) when you import them.

arguments.name: EXTENDFORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies whether to extend the character format width.

arguments.name: EXTENDVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a multiplier value that expands character variable lengths.

arguments.name: multiplier
arguments.description: specifies a multiplier value from 1 to 5 or you can specify AUTO. The lengths for character variables are increased by multiplying the current length by the specified value. The default value is 1. When 1 is used, the variable length is not extended. When AUTO is specified, the multiplier is set automatically.

arguments.name: Auto
arguments.description: AUTO is used to set the multiplier. This value is dependent on the encoding of the session and the data set in the transport file. When the file that is specified by INFILE= is in ANSI encoding or has no character encoding ID (CEI) information, a multiplier value of one is used. Otherwise, the extended length is calculated for you.

arguments.name: ISFILEUTF8=
arguments.description: specifies whether the file is encoded in UTF-8 format.

arguments.name: yes
arguments.description: specifies that the data set in the transport file is encoded as UTF-8.

arguments.name: no
arguments.description: specifies that the data set in the transport file is not encoded as UTF-8. NO is the default.

arguments.name: FORCE
arguments.description: enables access to a locked catalog.

arguments.name: INFILE=
arguments.description: specifies a previously defined fileref or the filename of the transport file to read.

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies that only data sets, only catalogs, or both, be moved when a library is imported.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies both catalogs and data sets be imported.

arguments.name: CATALOG
arguments.description: specifies only catalogs be imported.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: specifies only data sets be imported.

arguments.name: NEW
arguments.description: creates a new catalog for the imported transport file, and deletes any existing catalog with the same name.

arguments.name: NOEDIT
arguments.description: imports SAS/AF PROGRAM and SCL entries without Edit capability.

arguments.name: NOSRC
arguments.description: suppresses the importing of source code for SAS/AF entries that contain compiled SCL code.

arguments.name: SORT
arguments.description: causes the output data set to be re-sorted if necessary when PROC CIMPORT is used to import a sorted data set.

arguments.name: TAPE
arguments.description: reads the input transport file from a tape.

arguments.name: UPCASE
arguments.description: writes the alphabetic characters in uppercase to the output file.

statements.name: EXCLUDE
statements.description: Excludes specified files or entries from the import process.
statements.help:
EXCLUDE 
      SAS file(s) | catalog        entry(s)
      </          MEMTYPE=mtype>
      
	</          ENTRYTYPE=entry-type>;

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to be excluded from the import process. Specify SAS filenames if you import a library; specify catalog entry names if you import an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the EXCLUDE statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to be excluded from the import process. Specify SAS filenames if you import a library; specify catalog entry names if you import an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the EXCLUDE statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single entry type for one or more catalog entries that are listed in the EXCLUDE statement. See .

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single member type for one or more SAS files listed in the EXCLUDE statement. Values for mtype can be

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies both catalogs and data sets be imported.

arguments.name: CATALOG
arguments.description: specifies only catalogs be imported.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: specifies only data sets be imported.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Specifies individual files or entries to import.
statements.help:
SELECT 
      SAS file(s) | catalog        entry(s)
      </          MEMTYPE=mtype>
	
      </          ENTRYTYPE=entry-type>;

arguments.name: SAS
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to import. Specify SAS filenames if you import a library; specify catalog entry names if you import an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the SELECT statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: catalog
arguments.description: specifies one or more SAS files or one or more catalog entries to import. Specify SAS filenames if you import a library; specify catalog entry names if you import an individual SAS catalog. Separate multiple filenames or entry names with a space. You can use shortcuts to list many like-named files in the SELECT statement. For more information, see .

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single entry type for one or more catalog entries that are listed in the SELECT statement. See .

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a single member type for one or more SAS files listed in the SELECT statement. Valid values are CATALOG or CAT, DATA, or ALL.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies both catalogs and data sets be imported.

arguments.name: CATALOG
arguments.description: specifies only catalogs be imported.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: specifies only data sets be imported.
